txt.en: Instance: The Deadly Dinner
'Couldn't bother with a timely arrival, Dagrun? Tsk tsk!'
Maeriel is dead!\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun!
Someone has broken down the front door!
'Dagrun, have you met Sútvif? Her son was killed by those Easterlings. The poor dear.'
Check on Hoskuld
'I have also been working with the orphanage to make sure all our children whose parents died in the battle are well cared for.'
Talk to Dagrun
Hoskuld is dead!
Find Háta
'Hmph.'
'Please set aside these accusations and let me out of here! I cannot remain beside these dead bodies!'
'Laying it on a bit thick, are you not, Orgrand? The commoners might fall for a wink and a smile, and all these talks of charity, but we do not.'
'Háta has been strangled?! Hoskuld's death could not have been an accident then. We are locked inside this manor with a murderer....'
A grand dinner is being hosted by the Elders of Lake-town, but the shadow of the late Master's murder still hangs over the manor. Something wicked is about to unfold.
Háta is dead!
Maeriel lies slumped on the floor. She has been stabbed through the back with a carving knife!
Talk to Dagrun
'He is dead?! What?!'
Check on Maeriel
Dagrun has been waiting for you.\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun.
'Oh no, not another! Orgrand, what happened?'
Talk to Dagrun
'I believe it is customary here to await the host before eating.'
Hoskuld ran into the kitchen, seeming unwell.\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun.
Hoskuld lies on the floor, unmoving, his face a deep maroon colour. You lean in closer and realize he is not breathing!
'He is dead? How could this have happened?'
'Álarr!'
Maeriel is dead!
'Álarr, there is a murderer among us! Only we five still live!'
Hoskuld ran into the kitchen, seemingly unwell.\n\nYou should check on Hoskuld.
'The food! It must be poisoned!'
'I can vouch for Frekur as well.'
[placeholder]! It must have been!'
Háta lies on the floor. You see red marks around her neck. She has been strangled!
'What are you saying?! I cannot withstand such an insinuation when my own wife lies among the dead!'
TBD
'A timely question! Let us look for them.'
'I fear this will only become easier for the murderer as our numbers thin. Where is Orgrand? I realize I have not seen him in quite a while.'
TBD
'Dagrun, Orgrand, Frekur, come with me. We will confer with the other Elders.
Orgrand seems disoriented and barely notices you approach.\n\n'What... what happened? I think someone struck me... Sútvif?'
'It seems everyone else has already arrived! Let us join them at the dinner table. And do be on your best behaviour.'
Some time passes
'You know very well that it could have been any of us! We did exactly what I said we should not do and split up!'
'It has been decided. Dagrun shall become Master of Lake-town.'
'Oh my, he did not seem well. Will you go check on him?'
'Her work for this town has been exemplary over a lengthy span. Her bravery and leadership in the face of death confirms that she is the clear choice.'
'I don't care what you all think! I am going upstairs to find a way out. Maybe there's an unlocked window!'
'Maeriel too... we must stay together now, [placeholder]. It is too easy for the fiend to end us one by one if we separate.'
'Apologies, my Lords and Ladies. The Elders are on their way.'
You accuse Rikolf of murder!
'Rikolf, sir? Someone has come to the door asking for you.'
Dagrun did not commit the murders!
Orgrand did not commit the murders!
Frekur did not commit the murders!
Thewár looks to have several broken bones from the fall, but the back of his head is bloody, as if struck by a heavy object. He is dead!
'I'm not going to stand around here! One of you is a murderer and none can be trusted!'
'Rikolf, it cannot be! Wait....'
'You are the fool if you expect your measly wages will keep me by your side this time!'
'I will not be party to these accusations without witness. [placeholder] is a friend of my Prince and my people. Let me know when more sensible conclusions prevail, Dagrun.'
'You are not my son! This man is in disguise! What have you done with my son?'
'Everyone calm down. We do not know it was the food. Quickly, someone go fetch a healer!'
'Thewár! His head has been struck!'
'That is a ridiculous accusation. [placeholder] would never commit such a dishonourable crime!'
'Dagrun and I were with [placeholder] when this happened. It could not have been {her[f]|him[m]}.'
'No one panic. Someone will come soon to let us out. For now, do not eat or drink anything, just to be safe.'
'Thank goodness... [placeholder], may I have a word with you?'
'Please, everyone be calm! If there is a murderer among us, we are safer if we stay together!'
'Where are Orgrand and that woman?'
'And the servants are missing!'
You Accuse Rikolf of Murder!
'Hold. None of you may leave until the truth is known. [placeholder], you have proven yourself worthy of my regard. Please tell me what happened here.'

You tell Captain Álarr all that has transpired.\n\n'The murderer must be someone present. There was no way into the manor from the outside. I no longer believe Skótmun was responsible for the Master's death either. Who had the most to gain by these deaths? It must be someone who would be in the running for the position; one of these four. I know it was not you, [placeholder]. You have been involved in the investigation from the beginning! Tell me who did this.'
'Is your companion even who you claim? Or does she resort to trickery as well?'
'Surely everyone is here. Can we eat now? I tire of just staring at this food!'
You hear someone break open the door downstairs!
'Bah. I do not wish to offend, but I cannot endure waiting for the Elders much longer!'
'It was Dagrun and [placeholder]! They are ruthless criminals!'

'Tell me, [placeholder], how did these three behave in this time of crisis?'

You tell the Elder of Orgrand's cowardice, Frekur's belligerence, and how Dagrun remained calm and collected while taking leadership.

'I see. It is just as I thought. I will go and speak to the other Elders. Wait here.'
The dinner guests are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
You must accuse someone of murder!\n\nChoose wisely!
The dinner guests are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'Master! I've been named Master! I wish it had not been in such gruesome circumstances. I think I'm in shock.'
Rikolf the Elder wants to speak with you.\n\nYou should talk to Rikolf the Elder.
'Let us give them some space to take the victims away.'
The dinner guests are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'He is probably not used to the rich foods of Men.'
The dinner guests are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'Who is that? Are you expecting someone? I will go with you.'
'Rikolf? That was unlike him.'
You hear someone shriek followed by a loud thumping sound
'How can we possibly be calm?! Someone has died!'
'[placeholder] found another body? How convenient!'
The dinner guests have all split up.\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun.
'I do not know. Someone struck me in the head....'
'Karazgar, the Weeping Warrior, will be pleased to know that his schemes have brilliantly unfolded this eve!'
The dinner guests are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'Ah, yes of course. I will be right there.'
Listen to the conversation
The dinner guests are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'No, no, wife. You stay here.'
The dinner guests are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
Talk to Captain Álarr
'The doors are all locked!'
Listen to the conversation
Listen to the conversation
Accuse the Murderer!
'Associating with murderers now, Dagrun? I see you will do anything to gain a foothold above your current station!'
'I am starting to wonder why you are so quick to blame all of this on [placeholder].'
Thewár has suddenly fallen down the stairs!\n\nYou should check on Thewár!
Listen to the conversation
Talk to Rikolf the Elder
'I will be taking this one. You should wait here.'
'You are not in charge here, Dagrun!'
'Fools, all of them! Panicking is not the solution here. Maeriel is a friend, however, and I do worry about her. Will you please go check on her?'
Thewár is dead!\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun!
Talk to Dagrun
'What is happening here?! I order everyone to come downstairs!'
Listen to the conversation
Listen to the conversation
Listen to the conversation
'You know, that Mervárth fellow she spends her time with has always struck me as unsavoury....'
Dagrun has been named Master!\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun.
A loud crash came from upstairs.\n\nYou should find the source of the crash.
'Rikolf, you stand accused and must accompany me.'
Captain Álarr has arrived downstairs.\n\nYou should talk to Álarr.
'Do not be a fool, Thewár!'
'Guard, go to Rikolf's home and see if the man who truly bears that name is within.'
'Ugh... I suddenly feel unwell… very… not good…'
'Do not move, you.'
'My wife is dead?! You... You must have done this! And killed that dwarf, too! You fiend!'
Check on Thewár
'Is he all right?'
Hoskuld is dead!\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun!
'Wait, where is my wife?'
Háta did not return with the others.\n\nYou should find Háta.
Thewár is dead!
Talk to Dagrun
Talk to Dagrun
'I doubt this book-case fell over on its own.'
Talk to Dagrun
'Congratulations, Dagrun! May we achieve great things together! Eheh....'
Accuse someone of murder!
'I have not. I am sorry for your loss, Sútvif.'
'Good! I am starving!'
'What?! How dare you!'
Háta is dead!\n\nYou should talk to Dagrun!
Talk to Dagrun
Find the source of the crash
'You know this is untrue, Rikolf. I will speak on their behalf.'
'Greetings, Dagrun.'
'Rikolf is alive, sir! He was bound and gagged, his clothes stolen for this ruse!'
'I cannot take it anymore! I am going to eat!'
You hear a loud crash upstairs!
Maeriel has left the room, angered at the other guests' behaviour.\n\nYou should go check on Maeriel.
